flawed_nl_solution:
Wearing the high-tech shoes, Candace can hike 6 mph * 2 = <<6*2=21>>21 mph for the first two hours.
Then she gets one blister, so her speed drops to 21 mph - 2 mph = <<21-2=19>>19 mph for the next two hours of the hike.
Candace spends an equal amount of time walking at 21 mph and 19 mph, so we can average the two speeds to find an overall speed of (21 mph + 19 mph)/2 = <<(21+19)/2=20>>20 mph.
#### 20

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 21. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
